alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 8:07AM EDT until July 24 at 10:30AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF CHESAPEAKE, THE CITY OF NORFOLK, THE CITY OF PORTSMOUTH AND THE EASTERN CITY OF SUFFOLK... At 807 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Virginia Beach, Old Dominion University, Downtown Portsmouth, Downtown Norfolk, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Ocean View, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Ghent, Norfolk NAS, Cradock, Norview, Western Branch, Wards Corner, South Norfolk, Huntersville and Willoughby Spit. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Suffolk
